result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:42 AM Defendant Lucas M Shively not in court.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Lucas M Shively.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Lucas M Shively.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has to late appearance. Counsel requesting adjournment. Bail to continue.

records.addlTxt:
Judge Steve Cain sitting for Judge Paul Malloy - 11:40 AM Defendant Lucas M Shively in court by video due to health concerns and by Attorney Martin Russell Tanz. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Maddie Morgan sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Lindsay, cross exam by Atty. Tanz. Defense moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(8:20 am) Defendant called COC's Office indicated feeling ill today and unable to appear.  Clerk advised def to contact his atty.  Email sent to clerk and counsel.
Clerk DK notified DA/Atty. Tanz defendant can appear on zoom for PH today. Atty. Tanz will notify defendant.
US Postal Service Notice - mail for defendant has been forwarded to:402 W Oakland Ave Port Washington WI 53074

Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas M Shively appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Lucas M Shively.  Defendant does qualify for public defender.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives reading.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties, and finds probable cause.  State recommends $750 cash bail.  Counsel as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Counsel waives time limits and requests date for status on preliminary hearing.
